SENT.plain: Objective: To report two cases of cerebral venous sinus thrombosis with papilledema and visual loss that improved after endovascular stent placement
Materials and methods: Retrospective case series from a tertiary ophthalmic center
Results: Two cases of venous sinus occlusion treated with angioplasty and stenting are described
Both cases experienced improvement in optic disc edema and visual function following the procedures
Conclusion: Endovascular stent placement may relieve increased intracranial pressure and papilledema caused by cerebral sinus thrombosis and may prevent further visual loss
